poem:
### In Xianniangxi  

In southern gardens, water weaves  
a desperate sermon—soil, breathless,  
bowing to the flood's insistence.  
Li Jie leans against the rain,  
finds warmth in the weave of hands,  
in fields of whispered promise,  
threads of hope stitched deep,  
patchwork in the storm's eternal attire.
